user.title: Aquarium AI Setup - Basic Settings
user.description: Configure basic tank settings and AI preferences. You'll then select sensors and add optional tank information.

data.run_analysis_on_startup: Run Analysis on Home Assistant Startup

data_description.tank_name: Enter a custom name for your aquarium (e.g., 'Main Tank', 'Reef Setup', 'Community Tank'). This name will appear in notifications and service calls.
data_description.aquarium_type: Specify your aquarium type to provide context for AI analysis. Common types include Freshwater, Marine, Brackish, or custom types like 'Cichlid Tank' or 'Reef Aquarium'.
data_description.update_frequency: Select how often the AI should analyze your aquarium sensors and send notifications. Choose based on your monitoring needs - more frequent for sensitive setups, less frequent for stable systems.
data_description.ai_task: Select an AI task entity from your Home Assistant configuration (e.g., ai_task.google_ai_task or ai_task.openai_ai_task).
data_description.auto_notifications: When enabled, notifications are sent automatically at the configured frequency. When disabled, notifications are only sent when triggered manually using the service.
data_description.notification_format: Choose the level of detail for notification messages. Full format provides comprehensive parameter analysis, condensed format shows brief analysis, and minimal format displays only parameter values with overall assessment.
data_description.run_analysis_on_startup: When enabled, the AI analysis will run 60 seconds after Home Assistant starts (in addition to the regular scheduled interval). When disabled (default), analysis only runs at the scheduled interval or when manually triggered.

sensors.title: Aquarium AI Setup - Sensors
sensors.description: Select the sensors to monitor your aquarium (at least one required). You can also optionally add a camera for visual analysis.

data_description.temperature_sensor: Choose the temperature sensor entity that monitors your aquarium. Temperature sensors with proper device class are preferred.
data_description.ph_sensor: Select a sensor that measures pH levels in your aquarium. pH may not have units.
data_description.salinity_sensor: Choose a sensor that measures salinity or specific gravity in your aquarium.
data_description.dissolved_oxygen_sensor: Select a sensor that measures dissolved oxygen levels in your aquarium water.
data_description.water_level_sensor: Choose a sensor that measures water level. This can be numeric (e.g., 80%) or text (e.g., Normal/High/Low).
data_description.orp_sensor: Select a sensor that measures Oxidation-Reduction Potential (ORP/Redox) in your aquarium. ORP indicates water quality and the balance of oxidizing and reducing agents.
data_description.camera: Select a camera entity that provides a view of your aquarium. The AI will analyze the image for water clarity, fish health, plant condition, and general aquarium maintenance needs. Visual analysis complements sensor data for comprehensive monitoring.

tank_info.title: Aquarium AI Setup - Tank Information
tank_info.description: Optional: Add tank details for better AI analysis. This information helps the AI provide more accurate recommendations.

data_description.tank_volume: Enter your aquarium's total water volume (e.g., '100 liters', '50 gallons', '200L'). The AI will use this to provide context-aware recommendations for water changes and stocking levels.
data_description.filtration: Describe your filtration system including type, flow rate, and filter media (e.g., 'Canister filter 1200 L/h with ceramic media, activated carbon, and bio-balls'). This helps the AI assess if your filtration is adequate for your tank.
data_description.water_change_frequency: Specify how often you perform water changes (e.g., '25% weekly', '20% every 2 weeks', '10% twice per week'). The AI will consider this when evaluating water quality and making recommendations.
data_description.inhabitants: List your aquarium inhabitants with approximate quantities (e.g., '10 Neon Tetras, 5 Corydoras Catfish, 2 Angelfish, 10 Cherry Shrimp'). The AI uses this to assess bioload, compatibility, and parameter requirements.
data_description.last_water_change: Select an input_datetime helper (recommended) or date/time sensor that tracks when you last performed a water change. The AI will factor in time elapsed when making water change recommendations. See README for setup instructions.
data_description.misc_info: Add any additional information about your tank that might help the AI provide better analysis (e.g., 'Recently added new fish', 'Using CO2 injection', 'Treating for ich', 'Heavy planting'). This context helps the AI understand special circumstances.

ai_prompts.title: Aquarium AI Setup - AI Prompts
ai_prompts.description: Optional: Customize AI prompts for analysis. Default prompts are provided and can be edited as needed.

data_description.prompt_main_instructions: Main instructions for AI analysis. Include general guidelines about how to analyze the aquarium. Use {aquarium_type} placeholder where needed.
data_description.prompt_parameter_guidelines: Guidelines for parameter ranges and units. Define healthy ranges for temperature, pH, salinity, dissolved oxygen, ORP, and water level.
data_description.prompt_camera_instructions: Instructions for analyzing camera images. Define what the AI should look for in aquarium photos.
data_description.prompt_brief_analysis: Instructions for brief sensor analysis fields (ending with '_analysis'). Define format and length constraints.
data_description.prompt_detailed_analysis: Instructions for detailed notification analysis fields (ending with '_notification_analysis'). Define what details to include.
data_description.prompt_water_change: Instructions for water change recommendations. Define how to format water_change_recommended and water_change_recommendation fields.
data_description.prompt_overall_analysis: Instructions for overall health assessments. Define format for overall_analysis and overall_notification_analysis fields.

data.run_analysis_on_startup: Run Analysis on Home Assistant Startup

data_description.tank_name: Update the name for your aquarium. This name appears in all notifications and can help identify multiple tank setups.
data_description.aquarium_type: Change your aquarium type to improve AI analysis accuracy. The AI provides different recommendations based on aquarium type (e.g., Marine tanks need different parameter ranges than Freshwater).
data_description.update_frequency: Adjust notification frequency based on your needs. Use shorter intervals during critical periods (water changes, new fish) or longer intervals for stable, established tanks.
data_description.ai_task: Change which AI task entity to use for analysis. Select from available AI task entities in your Home Assistant setup.
data_description.auto_notifications: Toggle automatic notifications on/off. When disabled, notifications are only sent when manually triggered via the service.
data_description.notification_format: Choose how detailed the notification messages should be. Full format includes comprehensive analysis, condensed shows brief analysis, minimal shows only parameters and overall assessment.
data_description.run_analysis_on_startup: Toggle whether AI analysis runs when Home Assistant starts. When enabled, analysis runs 60 seconds after startup. When disabled (default), analysis only runs at the scheduled interval or when manually triggered.
